items.title: French VC firm Founders Future sells 25% stake to key investors
items.summary:
- Founders Future, a Paris-based venture capital firm, manages 300 million euro (US$324 million) in assets.
- The firm sold a 25% stake in its holding company to investors including MACSF, the Dassault family, and CMA CGM Group.
- Founders Future aims to reach 1 billion euro (US$1.1 billion) in assets by 2030 and plans to open two offices in the US.
- A US-focused growth fund will be launched, targeting investments between US$5 million and US$10 million in larger growth rounds of US$50 million or more.

items.title: Bezos-backed vertical farming firm Plenty files for bankruptcy
items.summary:
- Plenty, a vertical farming company based in San Francisco, filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy on Mar. 24.
- The company has secured $20.7 million in debtor-in-possession financing to maintain operations during the bankruptcy process.
- Plenty will concentrate on its strawberry farm in Virginia and its R&D center in Wyoming as part of its restructuring plan.
- Founded in 2014, Plenty raised nearly $1 billion from investors including SoftBank, Walmart, and Jeff Bezos.

items.title: Chinese robotics firm Elu.AI raises pre-series A
OpenAI taps chief operating officer to lead global expansion
items.summary:
- OpenAI appoints Brad Lightcap as COO to lead global expansion and corporate partnerships.
- The company partners with SoftBank Group and Oracle for a network of data centers under the US$500 billion Stargate project.
- Project aims to support large-scale AI-related workloads with Lightcap overseeing business strategy and partnerships.

items.title: China’s Xpeng EV denies Austria assembly rumors amid EU probe
items.summary:
- Xpeng denies knowledge of an agreement with Magna Steyr for vehicle assembly in Austria.
- The assembly would allow Xpeng to avoid EU import tariffs by completing production in Europe.
- Rumors coincide with EU's investigation into subsidies for Chinese EVs, possibly leading to higher tariffs on imports.

items.title: EaseMyTrip to enter aviation with Big Charter acquisition
items.summary:
- EaseMyTrip plans to acquire a 49% stake in Big Charter Private Limited, entering the charter aviation sector.
- The acquisition is pending final approval from the board and shareholders.
- This move aims to expand EaseMyTrip’s premium air travel services and increase its presence in Tier-II and Tier-III cities.
- Recent financial results show a 26% drop in profit and a 6% revenue decline for Q3 FY25.

items.title: Apple unveils iOS 18.4 with AI tools for smarter notifications
items.summary:
- Apple has released the iOS 18.4 release candidate featuring Priority Notifications.
- The AI-powered function emphasizes important notifications on iPhone lock screens.
- Update includes expanded Matter support for better smart device control via Apple Home.
- New features encompass AI-generated review summaries on the App Store, new shortcut actions, and Apple Intelligence support for iPhone 15 Pro.

items.title: US quantum computing firm PsiQuantum nets $750m, sources say
items.summary:
- PsiQuantum is raising at least US$750 million at a pre-money valuation of US$6 billion.
- BlackRock is leading the funding round, which is still ongoing.
- The company uses semiconductor manufacturing techniques to produce quantum processors and partners with GlobalFoundries to enhance production with photonics technology.
- Collaborative projects with the Australian and US governments aim to build quantum computers in Brisbane and Chicago.
- Quantum computers still struggle with high error rates, which limits their practical applications.

items.title: Bank of Korea tests digital currency for real-world use
UK crypto miner Argo Blockchain names former exec as CEO
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Argo Blockchain appoints Justin Nolan as new CEO.
- Nolan was previously chief growth officer and CEO of Arkon Energy.
- He succeeds Thomas Chippas, who left the role in January.
- This is Argo's second CEO change in over a year.
- Founded in 2017, Argo has faced significant challenges, including the sale of its Helios mining facility in Texas to avoid bankruptcy.
- Nolan previously contributed to expanding the company's operations and the Helios project.

items.title: Amazon India removes referral fees to support small sellers
items.summary:
- Amazon India to eliminate referral fees for over 12 million products priced below 300 rupees (US$3.51) starting April 7.
- Applies to 135+ categories including grocery, home decor, and apparel.
- Previously, sellers paid a 2-4% fee per sale; this aims to support small businesses.
- Shipping rates reduced: national shipping fees drop from 77 rupees (US$0.90) to 65 rupees (US$0.76).
- Lower weight handling fees for items under 1 kg; savings of up to 90% on additional units for multiple shipments.
- Amazon updates its Renewed platform, stopping sales of externally refurbished products while maintaining the service.
- Bureau of Indian Standards (BIS) seized uncertified products, citing consumer safety concerns.

items.title: Tesla to launch full self-driving feature in China
items.summary:
- Tesla announced on Mar. 24 that it will launch its smart driving-assistance feature in China after receiving regulatory approval.
- The rollout, previously scheduled between Mar. 17 and Apr. 16, comes after reports of potential delays on Chinese social media.
- The announcement indicates progress amid ongoing developments and challenges faced by Tesla in the region.

items.title: Blockchain-linked World Network plans Visa crypto wallet features
items.summary:
- World Network is in talks with Visa to integrate card features into a self-custody crypto wallet.
- The collaboration aims to enable Visa functionalities like fiat on- and off-ramps and stablecoin payments.
- The initiative will allow users to manage cryptocurrencies and fiat currencies, akin to a traditional bank account.

items.title: 20 fresh tech and startup jobs in Asia this week
items.author: TIA Jobs Bot
items.summary:
- A list of 20 popular tech job opportunities in Asia within the past week.
- Jobs span various companies in Indonesia, Malaysia, Vietnam, Singapore, and Hong Kong.
- Each listing includes company name, location, experience required, and salary range where provided.
- Companies listed include PT Appfuxion Consulting, Tech in Asia, and Super Effective among others.
- The article encourages job applications and provides a link for job postings.

items.title: Cassava, Nvidia to launch Africa’s first AI factory by 2025
items.author: Strive Masiyiwa
items.summary:
- Cassava Technologies partners with Nvidia to establish Africa’s first AI factory.
- The factory will operate at data centers in South Africa, expected to begin by June 2025.
- Plans to expand to data centers in Egypt, Kenya, Morocco, and Nigeria.
- Aims to provide AI infrastructure for African businesses, startups, and researchers.

items.title: Qiming Venture seeks to raise $800m as AI demand grows
items.summary:
- Qiming Venture Partners is seeking to raise US$800 million for a new fund amidst growing interest in AI startups in China.
- The fund may have an overall cap of US$1 billion, though details are still preliminary.
- Qiming, founded in 2006, has raised a total of US$9.5 billion and has had 12% of its 580 portfolio companies go public.

items.title: Aspire launches 3-month program for early-stage startups in SG
items.summary:
- Aspire, a finance platform in Singapore, launches Aspire Ignite, a three-month program for early-stage startups.  
- The program targets startups in the Asia Pacific that have raised pre-seed funding.  
- Participants will attend masterclasses on fundraising and investor engagement, including reverse pitch sessions with VCs.  
- Over US$200,000 in partner perks will be available, with finalists receiving US$25,000 from Aspire and US$500,000 in credits from Google, Microsoft, and Amazon.  
- Applications are open; the program starts on April 14.

items.title: LG Innotek to mass-produce humanoid robot parts by 2026
items.summary:
- LG Innotek plans to mass-produce key components for humanoid robots by 2026.
- Production volumes may increase tenfold annually starting from 2027 or 2028.
- The announcement was made by CEO Moon Hyuk-soo at a shareholders' meeting in Seoul.
- The company collaborates on robot hands, joints, and camera components, targeting the humanoid robot market for growth.
- Further updates will be shared at industry events like CES.
- Moon addressed potential tariffs on products made in Mexico due to US trade policies, mentioning ongoing negotiations to mitigate impact.
- He also predicted a recovery in demand for the EV industry by the end of 2025.

items.title: Musk sued by SEC for late Twitter share disclosure
items.summary:
- The SEC voted 4-1 in January 2025 to sue Elon Musk for violating securities laws regarding his Twitter shares purchase in 2022.
- Musk allegedly failed to disclose acquiring over 5% of Twitter shares within the mandatory 10-day window, saving him $150 million.
- His late disclosure caused a spike in Twitter's share price, but the SEC did not charge him with intent behind the delay.
- Commissioner Mark Uyeda dissenting and urged against political motivation claims, but staff did not support this due to SEC practices.

items.title: BYD launches Qin L EV sedan to rival Tesla
items.summary:
- BYD has launched the Qin L sedan to compete with Tesla’s Model 3 in the Chinese market.
- The Qin L, unveiled on Mar. 23, is priced at 119,800 yuan (approximately US$16,517).
- This price is significantly lower than Tesla Model 3’s starting price of 235,500 yuan (US$32,428).
- The Qin L has a driving range of 545 kilometers, while the Model 3 offers 634 kilometers.
- Both vehicles include basic self-driving features and a digital cockpit.

items.title: US software firm to buy healthtech company CentralReach
items.summary:
- Roper Technologies to acquire CentralReach for approximately $1.65 billion.
- CentralReach projected to generate $175 million in revenue and $75 million in EBITDA by June 30, 2026.
- The acquisition is expected to close in April or May 2025.

items.title: Open-source AI startup Browser Use nets $17m seed funding
items.summary:
- Open-source AI startup Browser Use has secured $17 million in seed funding.
- The funding round is aimed at expanding its development and outreach.
- This investment marks a significant step for the company in the competitive AI industry.

items.title: Identity security firm Linx Security hires ex-Microsoft exec as CTO
items.summary:
- Linx Security has appointed a former Microsoft executive as their new Chief Technology Officer (CTO).
- The appointment is part of Linx Security's initiative to bolster its identity security services.
- The new CTO brings extensive experience in technology and security from their previous tenure at Microsoft.

items.title: Xiaomi plans $5.27b share placement
items.summary:
- Xiaomi Corp plans to raise up to US$5.27 billion via a placement of 750 million Class B shares.
- Share prices are set between HK$52.80 (US$6.79) and HK$54.60 (US$7.03), reflecting a discount of 4.2% to 7.4% from the closing price of HK$57 (US$7.34) on Mar. 24.
- Proceeds will be used for business expansion, investment in research and technology, and general corporate purposes.
- Xiaomi has not yet commented on the development.

items.title: Philippine giants plug into EV charging space despite profit woes
items.summary:
- The Philippine Electric Vehicle Industry Development Act (EVIDA) mandates that at least 5% of parking slots in public and private properties must be for EV charging, aiming for 60,000 stations by 2028.
- EV adoption surged in the Philippines, with sales increasing by 21 times in 2024 compared to 2021; charging points grew from 86 in January 2024 to 413 by February 2025.
- Many EV owners prefer charging at home due to cost, posing challenges for charging station operators to profit; some are exploring hybrid business models by offering additional services.
- Companies like AC Mobility and ChargeEuropa are adopting innovative strategies, such as ad placements and serving both private and public vehicles, to boost income.

items.title: Hot or not: What SEA investors are betting on and what they’re ignoring
items.summary:
[Investors in Southeast Asia are focusing on tech sectors but neglecting traditional sectors.]
[The article highlights trends in funding and investment preferences across different industries.]
[Key insights include the shift of interest towards digital platforms and services, indicating a transformation in the investment landscape.]

items.title: Tesla halts FSD rollout in China amid stricter regulations
Indonesia’s Danantara reveals advisory team
items.summary:
- Indonesia’s sovereign wealth fund, Danantara, announced its advisory team on Mar. 24, focusing on a US$900 billion asset management strategy.
- The advisory team includes notable figures like former Presidents Joko Widodo and Susilo Bambang Yudhoyono, economist Jeffrey Sachs, hedge fund manager Ray Dalio, and former Thai Prime Minister Thaksin Shinawatra.
- Launched as part of President Prabowo Subianto’s plan for 8% economic growth by 2029, the fund will reinvest dividends into key sectors such as natural resources, AI, and energy.
- CEO Rosan Roeslani expressed confidence that the team will enhance market sentiment and create jobs.
- Danantara, the second sovereign wealth fund in Indonesia, will operate independently with directors from Bank Mandiri, HSBC, and the Indonesian central bank.

items.title: A jolly good fight for Jollibee
items.summary:
- Jollibee Foods Corporation (JFC) is expanding its coffee business in response to rising competition from Southeast Asia’s coffee startups.
- The company needs to retain its lead in the Philippines' food and beverage sector by appealing to younger consumers.
- JFC's recent acquisitions include brands like Compose Coffee and Coffee Bean & Tea Leaf, contributing to strong sales growth in their coffee and tea segment.

items.title: Kakao faces scrutiny over probes, fines, ethics issues
items.summary:
- Kakao Corp is under investigation for various issues including potential fines and ethical concerns.
- The scrutiny comes amid increasing regulatory oversight on tech firms in South Korea.
- The company's practices are being examined to ensure compliance with legal and ethical standards, leading to a broader conversation about corporate responsibility in the tech sector.

items.title: Japan’s Metaplanet buys $12.6m worth of bitcoin
items.summary:
- Japanese investment firm Metaplanet purchased 150 bitcoin valued at approximately $12.6 million at an average price of $83,801 per bitcoin.
- This acquisition increases Metaplanet's total holdings to 3,350 BTC, valued at around $291.3 million.
- The purchase follows the appointment of Eric Trump to Metaplanet’s Strategic Board of Advisors, with company aiming for 10,000 BTC by end of 2025.

items.title: Saudi developer Umm Al Qura surges 30% on IPO debut
items.summary:
- Shares of Umm Al Qura surged 30% to 19.50 riyals (US$5.20) upon debut on the Riyadh exchange.
- Initial public offering (IPO) price set at 15 riyals (US$4) per share, valuing the company at approximately US$5.75 billion.
- IPO raised US$523 million with significant interest, totaling US$126 billion in orders from institutional investors.
- Company is backed by Saudi Arabia’s sovereign wealth fund and is part of a major development project in Mecca valued at around US$27 billion.

items.title: Google’s Wiz deal may revive Israel’s housing sector
items.summary:
- Google’s $32 billion acquisition of Wiz may boost Israel's housing market by providing bonuses to 1,800 Wiz employees.
- In 2024, 100,000 apartment transactions were recorded, down 6.4% from 2022 and 33% from 2021's peak.
- Rising interest rates and a security crisis contributed to declining real estate activity in recent years.
- Historical trends suggest a correlation between high-tech sector growth and real estate performance.

items.title: These are the most active investors in Vietnam’s startups
Indian ecommerce startup Meesho plans $1b IPO
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Meesho plans to raise $1 billion through an IPO, advised by Morgan Stanley, Kotak Mahindra Capital, and Citi.
- Proposed valuation for Meesho stands at $10 billion, with possible entry of JP Morgan to the syndicate.
- Recent funding raised $250 million to $270 million, valuing the company between $3.9 billion and $4 billion, down from $4.9 billion.
- Founded in 2015 by Vidit Aatrey and Sanjeev Barnwal, Meesho supports over 1.5 million sellers and 140 million annual users in India.

items.title: Korean AI chipmaker FuriosaAI rejects Meta’s $800m offer
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- FuriosaAI turned down Meta's $800 million acquisition offer, choosing to stay independent. 
- The Seoul-based startup is focusing on growth and plans to close a Series C funding round soon. 
- CEO June Paik leads a company that specializes in AI inference semiconductors, with its latest RNGD processor built on a 5-nanometer process. 
- FuriosaAI's clients include LG AI Research and Saudi Aramco, and they are providing chip samples to customers.

items.title: US tech group challenges South Korea’s map data ban
items.summary:
- The Computer & Communications Industry Association (CCIA) is concerned about South Korea's ban on exporting high-precision map data.
- CCIA argues that the restrictions hinder fair competition between international providers and local firms.
- No export applications for map data have been approved for foreign companies, impacting US providers and threatening approximately $130.5 million in annual revenue.
- CCIA also criticized South Korea's Cloud Security Assurance Program for creating barriers to US cloud service providers.

items.title: Chinese equity issuance grows 119% as rules on tech sector eased
items.summary:
- Equity issuance by Chinese firms reached US$16.8 billion in Q1 2025, a 119% increase from last year.
- The Hang Seng Index has risen by 21% in 2025, outperforming other international indices.
- The MSCI China Index's P/E ratio is 11.7, lower than the MSCI U.S. Index (20.3) and S&P 500 (20.5), suggesting attractive valuations.
- Investor sentiment is shifting with more long-only investors showing interest in China despite ongoing risks.
- Eased regulatory pressures on the tech sector, following a summit led by President Xi Jinping, are attracting more investment.

items.title: Apple launches $99m clean energy fund in China
items.summary:
- Apple establishes a clean energy fund in China worth 720 million yuan (US$99.3 million) during CEO Tim Cook’s visit on Mar. 24.
- The initiative aims to enhance Apple’s clean energy capacity in the region.
- This fund is part of Apple’s goal to transition its entire supply chain to 100% renewable energy by 2030.
- The announcement aligns with Apple's ongoing efforts in environmental sustainability.

items.title: US genetic testing firm 23andMe files for bankruptcy
items.summary:
- 23andMe filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy on Mar. 23, 2025, and plans to undergo a court-supervised sale process.
- CEO Anne Wojcicki stepped down, with CFO Joe Selsavage taking over temporarily.
- The company secured approximately $35 million in debtor-in-possession financing and reported assets and liabilities between $100 million and $500 million.
- 23andMe's stock has fallen nearly 50% since the start of the year, and this decision followed a strategic evaluation by the board.

items.title: Swedish fintech firm Klarna files for $15b New York IPO
items.summary:
- Klarna has filed for an IPO on the New York Stock Exchange.
- This is its second attempt to go public in four years.
- The IPO could be priced in the first half of April with a valuation of at least $15 billion.
- The move is seen as optimistic for a revival of fintech IPOs, which have declined recently.

items.title: Israeli foodtech firm Brevel expands seed funding to $25m
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Brevel has expanded its seed funding round to $25 million with an additional $5 million investment.
- The funds will be used for developing microalgae-based protein and market expansion strategies.
- Key investors include NevaTeam Partners, Siddhi Capital, and the European Union’s EIC Fund.
- Brevel utilizes light and sugar-based fermentation in bioreactors to create neutral-flavored microalgae protein isolate.
- Revenue is also generated from functional oils, antioxidants, and nutritional fibers from microalgae biomass.
- The funding will help in expanding commercial activities and securing supply agreements for large-scale production.
- Brevel was founded by brothers Yonatan, Ido, and Matan Golan to address the demand for sustainable protein alternatives.

items.title: Ant Group cuts AI costs by 20% with Chinese chips
items.summary:
- Ant Group has cut AI costs by approximately 20% using Chinese-made chips from Alibaba and Huawei, while also utilizing AMD alternatives.
- The company aims to minimize reliance on Nvidia’s H800 GPUs due to US export restrictions.
- Ant’s AI models, based on the Mixture of Experts technique, achieve results comparable to Nvidia hardware but lack independent verification.
- Their models, Ling-Plus (290 billion parameters) and Ling-Lite (16.8 billion parameters), outperform Meta's Llama and DeepSeek in respective language benchmarks.
- Training one trillion tokens costs around 5.1 million yuan (US$880,000), significantly lower than traditional methods.
- Challenges noted in model training include stability issues related to hardware and structural changes.

items.title: Grab loads up on groceries
items.summary:
- Grab's grocery segment has outpaced its food delivery segment for two consecutive quarters.
- Potential for more supermarket acquisitions in Malaysia and beyond.
- Challenges include lower profit margins from some supermarket operations, but integration of tech and logistics could strengthen Grab's position in the grocery market.

items.title: Binance secures $2b funding as it strengthens compliance
items.summary:
- Binance has successfully secured $2 billion in funding.
- This funding aims to strengthen the company's compliance measures.
- The initiative is seen as a response to increasing regulatory scrutiny in the crypto industry.

items.title: Trump’s rare crypto comment boosts official memecoin by 5%
items.summary:
- Former President Donald Trump made a rare comment about cryptocurrency, which led to a 5% increase in an official memecoin value.
- The comment came during a recent event where Trump discussed various topics, including digital currencies.
- The memecoin experienced significant trading activity following the news, reflecting heightened interest in cryptocurrency markets after Trump's remarks.

items.title: Baidu goes back to basics as rivals and AI erode search empire
items.author: Shi Xiang
items.summary:
- Baidu's MEG lead, Julius Luo, acknowledged sluggish growth in 2024, with Baidu Search losing market share to rivals like Xiaohongshu.
- Reports show Xiaohongshu's daily search volume nearing 600 million, raising concerns over Baidu's shrinking dominance.
- Baidu tested a minimalist app version, retaining only essential features, keeping major revenue source, Content Feed, hidden.
- Slogan reverted to its original form, focusing on basic search functionalities.
- Baidu integrated its chatbot Ernie Bot and DeepSeek for enhanced search capabilities, amidst declining market shares.
- Market share dropped from 87% in 2021 to 56% in early 2024, attributed to the competition.
- Recent earnings reported a 7% decline in online advertising revenue, continuing a trend of diminishing ad revenue over four quarters.
- Baidu's app MAUs declined from 704 million to 679 million, indicating reduced user engagement.

items.title: Tether seeks Big Four audit to boost transparency
items.summary:
- Tether is in discussions with a Big Four accounting firm for an audit of its reserves.
- CEO Paolo Ardoino emphasized the audit as a “top priority” without providing specifics on the firm or timeline.
- Tether reported over $94 billion in US Treasury bills and $108 million in cash and bank deposits as of December 31, 2024.
- In 2024, Tether bought $33.1 billion in US Treasury bills, making it the seventh-largest buyer of US government debt.

items.title: Google’s $32b Wiz deal to strengthen multicloud protection
items.summary:
- Google is acquiring cybersecurity firm Wiz for US$32 billion, its largest deal ever, closing in 2026.
- The acquisition aims to enhance Google Cloud’s security for multicloud environments.
- CEO Sundar Pichai highlights the need to tackle evolving cyber threats.
- Google Cloud CEO Thomas Kurian states Wiz's solutions will complement existing offerings.
- The deal underscores the rising threats related to AI and its significance in bolstering cloud security.

items.title: Golf-tech brand Deemples expands into Thailand
items.summary:
- Deemples, a golf-tech company, is expanding its presence into Thailand.
- This expansion aims to tap into the growing demand for golf-related services in the region.
- The move is part of Deemples’ strategy to enhance user experience and accessibility for golfers in Southeast Asia.
